CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , a town in LOC .
CARDINAL . As a victim of GPE , the applicant was entitled to benefits . Considering himself underpaid , he brought CARDINAL actions against a local welfare authority .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG awarded the applicant MONEY ( RUB ) in arrears . This judgment became binding on DATE and was enforced on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG awarded the applicant RUB CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL in arrears and fixed a new amount of periodic payments . This judgment became binding on DATE . The welfare authority considered that the award contained an error to the extent that it had not taken into account a past payment . For this reason , on DATE ORG clarified the judgment and reduced the award to RUB CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL . The judgment was enforced by CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . Under LAW of DATE , a bailiff must enforce a judgment within DATE . Under section QUANTITY of LAW of DATE , ORG must enforce a judgment within DATE .
